alert.note: Alert for Cole; Franklin; Gasconade; Moniteau; Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 7:45PM CDT until August 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and east central Missouri, including the following areas, in central Missouri, Cole MO, Moniteau MO and Osage MO. In east central Missouri, Franklin MO and Gasconade MO. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms capable of producing high rain rates and localized flash flooding remain possible through the remainder of the evening and overnight. The threat of flash flooding remains greatest in areas where multiple thunderstorms move across the same areas, and also in areas where soils remain saturated from recent rains.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
